methods.initializeExternalStreaming:
Convenience method to allow chaining of construction and calls to
 readExternalStreaming(ObjectInput, TIntObjectMap).

Note: Java generics information - <TYPE extends io.deephaven.tuple.serialization.StreamingExternalizable>

:param in: (java.io.ObjectInput) - The input
:param cachedReaders: (gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<io.deephaven.tuple.serialization.SerializationUtils.Reader>) - The cached readers
:return: (TYPE) this
methods.readExternalStreaming:
Alternative to Externalizable.readExternal(ObjectInput) for use when a series of tuples of the
 same type with the same element types are being read in iterative fashion.
 
 Primitive elements should be read with their primitive read methods (e.g. DataInput.readInt()).
 
 Object elements are preceded by a boolean, true if null, false otherwise. The first non-null value for a given
 Object element is then preceded by the name of the class. All non-null values are then read with a reader method
 from SerializationUtils.getReader(Class, ObjectInput), cached in cachedReaders.

:param in: (java.io.ObjectInput) - The input
:param cachedReaders: (gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<io.deephaven.tuple.serialization.SerializationUtils.Reader>) - The cached readers
methods.readObjectElement:
Implement the Object element reading protocol described in
 readExternalStreaming(ObjectInput, TIntObjectMap).

Note: Java generics information - <ITEM_TYPE>

:param in: (java.io.ObjectInput) - The input
:param cachedReaders: (gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<io.deephaven.tuple.serialization.SerializationUtils.Reader>) - The cached readers
:param itemIndex: (int) - The index into the cached readers for this item
:return: ITEM_TYPE
methods.writeExternalStreaming:
Alternative to Externalizable.writeExternal(ObjectOutput) for use when a series of tuples of the
 same type with the same element types are being written in iterative fashion.
 
 Primitive elements should be written with their primitive write methods (e.g.
 DataOutput.writeInt(int)).
 
 Object elements are preceded by a boolean, true if null, false otherwise. The first non-null value for a given
 Object element is then preceded by the name of the class. All non-null values are then written with a writer
 method from SerializationUtils.getWriter(Class, ObjectOutput), cached in cachedWriters.

:param out: (java.io.ObjectOutput) - The output
:param cachedWriters: (gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<io.deephaven.tuple.serialization.SerializationUtils.Writer>) - The cached writers
methods.writeObjectElement:
Implement the Object element writing protocol described in
 writeExternalStreaming(ObjectOutput, TIntObjectMap).

Note: Java generics information - <ITEM_TYPE>

:param out: (java.io.ObjectOutput) - The output
:param cachedWriters: (gnu.trove.map.TIntObjectMap<io.deephaven.tuple.serialization.SerializationUtils.Writer>) - The cached writers
:param itemIndex: (int) - The index into the cached writers for this item
:param item: (ITEM_TYPE) - The item to write

text:
Interface for "tuple" classes of variably-typed elements that support an alternative to
 Externalizable for writing in streaming fashion.
